column4: How can I install the rt2x00 drivers for my rt2500 rather than the rt2500 drivers already included in my Gutsy kernel? I see the source via apt-get, but this would require a custom kernel. Any way I can avoid rolling my own for support?
You only need to build the custom drivers, not the whole kernel.
You cna install and use `module-assistant' for that.
when I run make from the rt2x00 directory in /usr/src/modules I get errors...
Did you install the required kernel-headers package?
the first is  #error Wireless radio support not enabled in kernel!
I'll pastebin the rest. one sec...
Hmmm... does the rt2x00 README mention any odd options needed for wifi? I'd have thought it would be fine with the normal ones.
how can i cross-reference the requirements with the options set in my default gutsy kernel image>
The options in the current kernel are set in /boot/config-$(uname -r)
CONFIG_NET_RADIO doesn't appear in my current conifg.
Not set in mine either, but it does wifi just fine.
I suspect those drivers might just be out of date wrt kernel config.
